title: Bug 12906 [Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error message)
description: Bug 12906 [Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error message)
OB: If a file is already opened in one editor, and the user tries to open the same file in another editor, nothing happens and there is no warning or error message displayed.
EB: When a user tries to open a file in an editor that is already opened in another editor, the workbench should display a warning message indicating that they may overwrite changes and asking if they want to continue, or an error message stating that they should close all files first before opening the file in the new editor.
SR:
1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your Java file.
2. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files.
3. In the Java Perspective, right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
4. A Notepad or WordPad window will pop up with the Java file opened. Close it.
5. Go to the Java Perspective and open a Java file by double-clicking on it.
6. The file should now be opened in the workbench.
7. Right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
8. The workbench should display a warning message saying that you may overwrite changes and asking if you want to continue, or an error message stating that you should close all files first before opening the file in the new editor.
